The ready way to good works, or, A treatise of charitie wherein, besides many other things, is shewed how wee may bee alwayes readie, and prepared both in affection and action to give cheerefully to the poor and to pious uses never heretofore published. By Richard Bernard, rector of the Parish of Batcombe in Sommerset-shire. Bernard, Richard, 1568-1641.
[22], 486, [6] p.
Printed by Felyx Kyngston, and are to be sold by Edward Blackmore, at the signe of the Angell in Pauls Church-yard, London : 1635.
Reproduction of the original in Emmanuel College (University of Cambridge). Library.
=======
